markdownRemark.html:
A few years ago, I got the idea that I should start a blog. I was a software engineer, working at a startup in New York City, and I was learning a ton of exciting things about building software. I promptly bought a domain, cloned a static site generator, published my first post, and patted myself on the back.

I never touched the blog again.

Now that I am a few years older and a manager of engineers, I wonder what I would say if I could meet with my former self in a one-on-one. One of my favorite parts of being a manager is working directly with my reports. I love helping them to reach their goals. It’s the most rewarding part of my job, seeing their self-confidence and determination grow. Perhaps a part of me feels like I’m conquering my own unfocused nature &emdash; if only vicariously &emdash; and I feel like, just maybe, I might be able to accomplish all those .

But coaching oneself is an entirely different challenge. It is
